config.name: YouTube
config.description: YouTube Data API v3 allows you to incorporate YouTube functionality into your application

part.text: The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more activity resource properties that the API response will include

channelId.text: The channelId parameter specifies a unique YouTube channel ID

home.text: Set this parameter's value to true to retrieve the activity feed that displays on the YouTube home page for the authenticated user

maxResults.text: The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set

mine.text: Set this parameter's value to true to retrieve a feed of the authenticated user's activities

pageToken.text: The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned

publishedAfter.text: The publishedAfter parameter specifies the earliest date and time that an activity could have occurred

publishedBefore.text: The publishedBefore parameter specifies the date and time before which an activity must have occurred

regionCode.text: The regionCode parameter instructs the API to return results for the specified country

meta.description: Returns a list of channel activity events that match the request criteria

part.text: The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more activity resource properties that the API response will include

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the activity

contentDetails.text: The contentDetails object contains information about the content associated with the activity

meta.description: Posts a bulletin for a user

part.text: The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more channel resource properties that the API response will include

categoryId.text: The categoryId parameter specifies a YouTube guide category, thereby restricting YouTube's search to that category

forUsername.text: The forUsername parameter specifies a YouTube username, thereby requesting the channel associated with that username

forHandle.text: The forHandle parameter specifies a YouTube handle, thereby requesting the channel associated with that handle

hl.text: The hl parameter instructs the API to retrieve localized resource metadata for a specific application language

id.text: The id parameter specifies a comma-separated list of the YouTube channel ID(s) for the resource(s) that are being retrieved

managedByMe.text: Set this parameter's value to true to instruct the API to only return channels managed by the content owner that the onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter specifies

maxResults.text: The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set

mine.text: Set this parameter's value to true to instruct the API to only return channels owned by the authenticated user

mySubscribers.text: Set this parameter's value to true to retrieve a list of channels that subscribed to the authenticated user's channel

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

pageToken.text: The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned

meta.description: Returns a collection of zero or more channel resources that match the request criteria

part.text: The part parameter serves two purposes in this operation. It identifies the properties that the write operation will set as well as the properties that the API response will include

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

id.text: The ID that YouTube uses to uniquely identify the channel

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the channel, such as its title, description, and thumbnail images

contentDetails.text: The contentDetails object encapsulates information about the channel's content

statistics.text: The statistics object encapsulates statistics for the channel

status.text: The status object encapsulates information about the privacy status of the channel

brandingSettings.text: The brandingSettings object encapsulates information about the branding of the channel

auditDetails.text: The auditDetails object encapsulates channel data that is relevant for YouTube Partners during the audit process

contentOwnerDetails.text: The contentOwnerDetails object encapsulates channel data that is relevant for YouTube Partners linked with the channel

localizations.text: The localizations object encapsulates translations of the channel's metadata

meta.description: Updates a channel's metadata

part.text: The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more channelSection resource properties that the API response will include

channelId.text: The channelId parameter specifies a YouTube channel ID

hl.text: The hl parameter instructs the API to retrieve localized resource metadata for a specific application language

id.text: The id parameter specifies a comma-separated list of the YouTube channelSection ID(s) for the resource(s) that are being retrieved

mine.text: Set this parameter's value to true to instruct the API to only return channelSections owned by the authenticated user

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

meta.description: Returns a collection of channelSection resources that match the request criteria

part.text: The part parameter serves two purposes in this operation. It identifies the properties that the write operation will set as well as the properties that the API response will include

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

onBehalfOfContentOwnerChannel.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwnerChannel parameter specifies the YouTube channel ID of the channel to which a video is being added

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the channel section, such as its type and style

contentDetails.text: The contentDetails object contains details about the channel section's content, such as a list of playlists or channels featured in the section

localizations.text: The localizations object encapsulates translations of the channel section's metadata

meta.description: Adds a channelSection resource

part.text: The part parameter serves two purposes in this operation. It identifies the properties that the write operation will set as well as the properties that the API response will include

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

id.text: The ID that YouTube uses to uniquely identify the channel section

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the channel section, such as its type and style

contentDetails.text: The contentDetails object contains details about the channel section's content, such as a list of playlists or channels featured in the section

localizations.text: The localizations object encapsulates translations of the channel section's metadata

meta.description: Updates a channel section

id.text: The id parameter specifies the YouTube channelSection ID for the resource that is being deleted

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

meta.description: Deletes a channel section

part.text: The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more comment resource properties that the API response will include

id.text: The id parameter specifies a comma-separated list of comment IDs for the resources that are being retrieved

maxResults.text: The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set

pageToken.text: The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned

parentId.text: The parentId parameter specifies the ID of the comment for which replies should be retrieved

textFormat.text: Set this parameter's value to html or plainText to instruct the API to return the comments left by users in html formatted or in plain text

meta.description: Returns a list of comment resources that match the API request parameters

part.text: The part parameter identifies the properties that the API response will include. Set the parameter value to snippet. The snippet part has a quota cost of 1 unit

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the comment, including its text

meta.description: Creates a new top-level comment

part.text: The part parameter identifies the properties that the API response will include. You must at least include the snippet part in the parameter value since that part contains all of the properties that the API uses to update a comment's text

id.text: The ID that YouTube uses to uniquely identify the comment

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the comment, including its text

meta.description: Modifies a comment

id.text: The id parameter specifies a comma-separated list of comment IDs that are having their moderation status changed

moderationStatus.text: Identifies the new moderation status of the specified comments

banAuthor.text: The banAuthor parameter lets you indicate that you want to automatically reject any additional comments written by the comment's author

meta.description: Sets the moderation status of one or more comments

id.text: The id parameter specifies the YouTube comment ID for the resource that is being deleted

meta.description: Deletes a comment

part.text: The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more commentThread resource properties that the API response will include

allThreadsRelatedToChannelId.text: The allThreadsRelatedToChannelId parameter instructs the API to return all comment threads associated with the specified channel

channelId.text: The channelId parameter instructs the API to return comment threads containing comments about the specified channel

id.text: The id parameter specifies a comma-separated list of comment thread IDs for the resources that should be retrieved

maxResults.text: The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set

moderationStatus.text: Set this parameter to limit the returned comment threads to a particular moderation state

order.text: The order parameter specifies the order in which the API response should list comment threads

pageToken.text: The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned

searchTerms.text: The searchTerms parameter instructs the API to limit the API response to only contain comments that contain the specified search terms

textFormat.text: Set this parameter's value to html or plainText to instruct the API to return the comments left by users in html formatted or in plain text

videoId.text: The videoId parameter instructs the API to return comment threads associated with the specified video ID

meta.description: Returns a list of comment threads that match the API request parameters

part.text: The part parameter identifies the properties that the API response will include. Set the parameter value to snippet. The snippet part has a quota cost of 1 unit

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the comment thread, including its top-level comment

replies.text: The replies object is a container object for a list of replies to the comment

meta.description: Creates a new top-level comment

part.text: The part parameter identifies the properties that the API response will include. You must at least include the snippet part in the parameter value since that part contains all of the properties that the API uses to update a comment thread's top-level comment

id.text: The ID that YouTube uses to uniquely identify the comment thread

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the comment thread, including its top-level comment

meta.description: Modifies the top-level comment in a comment thread

part.text: The part parameter specifies the i18nLanguage resource properties that the API response will include. Set the parameter value to snippet

hl.text: The hl parameter specifies the language that should be used for text values in the API response

meta.description: Returns a list of application languages that the YouTube website supports

part.text: The part parameter specifies the i18nRegion resource properties that the API response will include. Set the parameter value to snippet

hl.text: The hl parameter specifies the language that should be used for text values in the API response

meta.description: Returns a list of content regions that the YouTube website supports

part.text: The part parameter specifies the member resource properties that the API response will include. Set the parameter value to snippet

filterByMemberChannelId.text: Comma-separated list of channel IDs. Only data about members that are part of this list will be included in the response

hasAccessToLevel.text: Filter results to members that have access to a specific level

maxResults.text: The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set

mode.text: The mode parameter indicates which members to return

pageToken.text: The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned

meta.description: Retrieves a list of members that match the request criteria for a channel

part.text: The part parameter specifies the membershipsLevel resource properties that the API response will include. Set the parameter value to snippet

meta.description: Retrieves a list of all pricing levels offered by a creator to their fans

part.text: The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more playlistItem resource properties that the API response will include

id.text: The id parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more unique playlist item IDs

maxResults.text: The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

pageToken.text: The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned

playlistId.text: The playlistId parameter specifies the unique ID of the playlist for which you want to retrieve playlist items

videoId.text: The videoId parameter specifies that the request should return only the playlist items that contain the specified video

meta.description: Returns a collection of playlist items that match the API request parameters

part.text: The part parameter serves two purposes in this operation. It identifies the properties that the write operation will set as well as the properties that the API response will include

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the playlist item, such as its title and position in the playlist

contentDetails.text: The contentDetails object is included in the resource if the included item is a YouTube video

status.text: The status object contains information about the playlist item's privacy status

id.text: The ID that YouTube uses to uniquely identify the playlist item

kind.text: Identifies what kind of resource this is

meta.description: Adds a resource to a playlist

part.text: The part parameter serves two purposes in this operation. It identifies the properties that the write operation will set as well as the properties that the API response will include

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

id.text: The ID that YouTube uses to uniquely identify the playlist item

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the playlist item, such as its title and position in the playlist

contentDetails.text: The contentDetails object is included in the resource if the included item is a YouTube video

status.text: The status object contains information about the playlist item's privacy status

meta.description: Modifies a playlist item

id.text: The id parameter specifies the YouTube playlist item ID for the playlist item that is being deleted

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

meta.description: Deletes a playlist item

part.text: The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more playlist resource properties that the API response will include

channelId.text: This value indicates that the API should only return the specified channel's playlists

hl.text: The hl parameter instructs the API to retrieve localized resource metadata for a specific application language

id.text: The id parameter specifies a comma-separated list of the YouTube playlist ID(s) for the resource(s) that are being retrieved

maxResults.text: The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set

mine.text: Set this parameter's value to true to instruct the API to only return playlists owned by the authenticated user

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

onBehalfOfContentOwnerChannel.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwnerChannel parameter specifies the YouTube channel ID of the channel to which a video is being added

pageToken.text: The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned

meta.description: Returns a collection of playlists that match the API request parameters

part.text: The part parameter serves two purposes in this operation. It identifies the properties that the write operation will set as well as the properties that the API response will include

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

onBehalfOfContentOwnerChannel.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwnerChannel parameter specifies the YouTube channel ID of the channel to which a video is being added

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the playlist, such as its title and description

status.text: The status object contains information about the playlist's privacy status

contentDetails.text: The contentDetails object contains information about the playlist content, including the item count

localizations.text: The localizations object encapsulates translations of the playlist's metadata

meta.description: Creates a playlist

part.text: The part parameter serves two purposes in this operation. It identifies the properties that the write operation will set as well as the properties that the API response will include

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

id.text: The ID that YouTube uses to uniquely identify the playlist

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the playlist, such as its title and description

status.text: The status object contains information about the playlist's privacy status

contentDetails.text: The contentDetails object contains information about the playlist content, including the item count

localizations.text: The localizations object encapsulates translations of the playlist's metadata

meta.description: Modifies a playlist

id.text: The id parameter specifies the YouTube playlist ID for the playlist that is being deleted

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

part.text: The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more search resource properties that the API response will include. Set the parameter value to snippet

channelId.text: The channelId parameter indicates that the API response should only contain resources created by the channel

channelType.text: The channelType parameter lets you restrict a search to a particular type of channel

eventType.text: The eventType parameter restricts a search to broadcast events

forContentOwner.text: The forContentOwner parameter restricts the search to only retrieve resources owned by the content owner specified by the onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter

forDeveloper.text: The forDeveloper parameter restricts the search to only retrieve videos uploaded via the developer's application or website

forMine.text: The forMine parameter restricts the search to only retrieve videos owned by the authenticated user

location.text: The location parameter, in conjunction with the locationRadius parameter, defines a circular geographic area

locationRadius.text: The locationRadius parameter, in conjunction with the location parameter, defines a circular geographic area

maxResults.text: The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

order.text: The order parameter specifies the method that will be used to order resources in the API response

pageToken.text: The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned

publishedAfter.text: The publishedAfter parameter indicates that the API response should only contain resources created at or after the specified time

publishedBefore.text: The publishedBefore parameter indicates that the API response should only contain resources created before or at the specified time

q.text: The q parameter specifies the query term to search for

regionCode.text: The regionCode parameter instructs the API to return search results for the specified country

relatedToVideoId.text: The relatedToVideoId parameter retrieves a list of videos that are related to the video that the parameter value identifies

relevanceLanguage.text: The relevanceLanguage parameter instructs the API to return search results that are most relevant to the specified language

safeSearch.text: The safeSearch parameter indicates whether the search results should include restricted content as well as standard content

topicId.text: The topicId parameter indicates that the API response should only contain resources associated with the specified topic

type.text: The type parameter restricts a search query to only retrieve a particular type of resource

videoCaption.text: The videoCaption parameter indicates whether the API should filter video search results based on whether they have captions

videoCategoryId.text: The videoCategoryId parameter filters video search results based on their category

videoDefinition.text: The videoDefinition parameter lets you restrict a search to only include either high definition (HD) or standard definition (SD) videos

videoDimension.text: The videoDimension parameter lets you restrict a search to only retrieve 2D or 3D videos

videoDuration.text: The videoDuration parameter filters video search results based on their duration

videoEmbeddable.text: The videoEmbeddable parameter lets you to restrict a search to only videos that can be embedded into a webpage

videoLicense.text: The videoLicense parameter filters search results to only include videos with a particular license

videoSyndicated.text: The videoSyndicated parameter lets you to restrict a search to only videos that can be played outside youtube.com

videoType.text: The videoType parameter lets you restrict a search to a particular type of videos

meta.description: Returns a collection of search results that match the query parameters specified in the API request

part.text: The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more subscription resource properties that the API response will include

channelId.text: The channelId parameter specifies a YouTube channel ID

forChannelId.text: The forChannelId parameter specifies a comma-separated list of channel IDs

id.text: The id parameter specifies a comma-separated list of the YouTube subscription ID(s) for the resource(s) that are being retrieved

maxResults.text: The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set

mine.text: Set this parameter's value to true to retrieve a feed of the authenticated user's subscriptions

myRecentSubscribers.text: Set this parameter's value to true to retrieve a feed of the subscribers of the authenticated user in reverse chronological order (newest first)

mySubscribers.text: Set this parameter's value to true to retrieve a feed of the subscribers of the authenticated user

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

onBehalfOfContentOwnerChannel.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwnerChannel parameter specifies the YouTube channel ID of the channel to which a video is being added

order.text: The order parameter specifies the method that will be used to sort resources in the API response

pageToken.text: The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned

meta.description: Returns subscription resources that match the API request criteria

part.text: The part parameter serves two purposes in this operation. It identifies the properties that the write operation will set as well as the properties that the API response will include

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the subscription, including its title and the channel that the user subscribed to

contentDetails.text: The contentDetails object is included in the subscription resource returned by the API

subscriberSnippet.text: The subscriberSnippet object contains basic details about the subscriber

meta.description: Adds a subscription for the authenticated user's channel

id.text: The id parameter specifies the YouTube subscription ID for the resource that is being deleted

meta.description: Deletes a subscription

videoId.text: The videoId parameter specifies a YouTube video ID for which the custom video thumbnail is being provided

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

file.text: The image file to upload as a custom video thumbnail

meta.description: Uploads a custom video thumbnail to YouTube and sets it for a video

part.text: The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more video resource properties that the API response will include

chart.text: The chart parameter identifies the chart that you want to retrieve

hl.text: The hl parameter instructs the API to retrieve localized resource metadata for a specific application language

id.text: The id parameter specifies a comma-separated list of the YouTube video ID(s) for the resource(s) that are being retrieved

locale.text: The locale parameter instructs the API to retrieve localized resource metadata for a specific application language

maxHeight.text: The maxHeight parameter specifies the maximum height of the embedded player

maxResults.text: The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set

maxWidth.text: The maxWidth parameter specifies the maximum width of the embedded player

myRating.text: Set this parameter's value to like or dislike to instruct the API to only return videos liked or disliked by the authenticated user

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

pageToken.text: The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned

regionCode.text: The regionCode parameter instructs the API to return results for the specified country

videoCategoryId.text: The videoCategoryId parameter identifies the video category for which the chart should be retrieved

meta.description: Returns a list of videos that match the API request parameters

part.text: The part parameter serves two purposes in this operation. It identifies the properties that the write operation will set as well as the properties that the API response will include

autoLevels.text: The autoLevels parameter indicates whether YouTube should automatically enhance the video's lighting and color

notifySubscribers.text: The notifySubscribers parameter indicates whether YouTube should send a notification about the new video to users who subscribe to the video's channel

onBehalfOfContentOwner.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value

onBehalfOfContentOwnerChannel.text: The onBehalfOfContentOwnerChannel parameter specifies the YouTube channel ID of the channel to which a video is being added

stabilize.text: The stabilize parameter indicates whether YouTube should adjust the video to remove shaky camera motions

snippet.text: The snippet object contains basic details about the video, including its title, description, and category

status.text: The status object contains information about the video's uploading, processing, and privacy statuses

contentDetails.text: The contentDetails object contains information about the video content, including the length of the video and an indication of whether captions are available for the video

localizations.text: The localizations object encapsulates translations of the video's metadata

recordingDetails.text: The recordingDetails object encapsulates information about the location, date and address where the video was recorded

meta.description: Uploads a video to YouTube and optionally sets the video's metadata

videoId.text: The videoId parameter identifies the video that is being reported

reasonId.text: The reasonId parameter identifies the reason that the video is being reported

secondaryReasonId.text: The secondaryReasonId parameter lets you specify a secondary reason if the primary reason does not fully capture the violation

comments.text: The comments parameter lets you provide additional information about the abuse report
